markdown:
**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 155 **Usage** affixed to armor **Activate**envision **Trigger** varies, see entry --- These wooden discs sometimes form spontaneously at the Wood Pile, a secret [conrasu](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=43) location suffused with extraplanar energy. A conrasu coin can be activated to call upon the power of a specific type of [aeon](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=2). Conrasu Coin (Arbiter) **Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 155 **Price** 7 gp --- **Trigger** You attempt a [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) check to [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=50).
This coin has small wings like an [arbiter](/Monsters.aspx?ID=6), the messenger and diplomat aeon. When you activate the coin, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus on the Diplomacy check, which increases to a +3 circumstance bonus to Make an Impression on a lawful creature. Conrasu Coin (Bythos) **Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 155 **Price** 200 gp --- **Trigger** You're targeted with an attack but the opponent hasn't rolled yet.
This cog-like coin bears an hourglass on one side and the four-armed silhouette of a [bythos](/Monsters.aspx?ID=539)—aeons that steward over time—on the other. When activated, you catch a glimpse of your body moving on one of its potential timelines in response to danger and you follow those movements to dodge. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the attack, and after resolving the attack, you can Stride up to 10 feet without triggering reactions. If you have the [Nimble Roll](/Feats.aspx?ID=574) feat and the attack misses, you can Stride up to 20 feet instead.
name: Conrasu Coin
